informal_statement: If $ \sqrt{x+\!\sqrt{x+\!\sqrt{x+\!\sqrt{x+\cdots}}}}=9$, find $x$. Show that it is 72.
informal_proof: We know that $ \sqrt{x+\!\sqrt{x+\!\sqrt{x+\!\sqrt{x+\cdots}}}}=9$, so $\sqrt{x+9}=9$. Squaring both sides we get $x+9=81$, so $x=81-9=72$.
formal_statement:
theorem mathd_algebra_31:
  fixes x :: real
    and u :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> n. u (n + 1) = sqrt (x + u n)"
    and "filterlim u at_top (nhds 9)"
  shows "9 = sqrt (x + 9)"
